subject: Investing
title: When to Take Cash vs. Reinvest
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on When to Take Cash vs. Reinvest.

hook.text: A couple reinvested dividends for 30 years, then flipped the switch to cash payouts the day they retired.

buildup.text: During accumulation years, reinvesting maximizes compounding. During retirement, cash payouts fund living expenses.

discovery.text: The transition point depends on when your dividend income covers your essential expenses without selling shares.

twist.text: Some retirees partially reinvestâ€”taking cash for bills and reinvesting the rest to keep the snowball growing.

climax.text: The beauty of a dividend portfolio: you never have to sell shares to generate income in retirement.

punchline.text: Reinvest while you earn. Cash out when you need. That's the dividend lifecycle.

quiz.question: When should dividend investors switch from reinvesting to taking cash?
options: When dividend income covers essential living expenses
